seriesJson.title: Georgetown forum
seriesJson.description: Moderated by Wallace Fanning, this series presents a panel of guests discussing a variety of topics. The radio series launched in 1946. It also later aired on WTTG-TV in Washington, D.C. These programs aired 1968-69.

node.title: The scientist and ethics
node.description: This program features a discussion with Rev. Frances J. Heiden, Georgetown University; Dr. Lawrence S. Williamfield, Georgetown University; and Dr. Raymond Seger, National Science Foundation.

node.title: Writers' conference
node.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Wiley Hughes, founder and director of Georgetown University Writers Conference; Patricia McGurren, novelist; Marjorie Holmes, writer and columnist; and Dr. Roland Flint, Georgetown University.

node.title: U.S. commitments to Latin America
node.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Thomas Dodd, Georgetown University; and Dr. Norman A. Bailey, City University of New York.

node.title: Disturbed children: Institution or home?
node.description: This program feature a discussion with Robert E. Costello, Christchild Institute for Children;  Dr. William B. Klotworthy, Christchild Institute for Children;  and Dr. Edmund S. Kissler, Georgetown University.

node.title: A bench view of crime
node.description: This program features a discussion with Edward M. Curran, Chief Judge, United States District Courts for District of Columbia; and Joseph M.F. Ryan, Jr., Judge of District of Columbia Court of General Sessions.

node.title: Drug addiction and crime
node.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Alan Z. Schwarzberg, Georgetown University; Dr. David Lanham, George Washington University; and Dr. James L. Foy, Georgetown University.

node.title: The law, the individual
node.description: This program features a discussion with Georgetown University  students Barry Portence of Texas, Willie Cook of Washington, D.C., Barbara Cohen of New Jersey, and John Argiola of New York.

node.title: Juvenile crime and elder generation
node.description: This program features a discussion with Patricia Rukle, dean of women, Georgetown University; Professor George R. Houston, Jr., Georgetown University; and Professor Eugene K. Snyder, Georgetown University.

node.title: Latin America: New left
node.description: This program features Dr. Luis E. Aguilar, Georgetown University, author of "Marxism in Latin America";  and Dr. Brady Tyson, American University.

node.title: World money outlook
node.description: This program features Pierre Paul Schweitzer, International Monetary Fund; Charles A. Serrone, Kiplinger Publications; and L.A. Jennings, chief executive officer and chairman of the board, Riggs National Bank.

node.title: Soviet Jews' plight
node.description: This program features Dr. Isaac Franck, executive vice president, Jewish Community Council of Greater Washington; Leon Volkoff, Newsweek; Roland R. Higstaff, editor, Liberty Magazine, a Seventh Day Adventist publication.

node.title: Latin America: Student dissent
node.description: This program features Dr. Thomas Dodd, Georgetown University; Dr. Harold E. Davis, American University; and Armando Mon, American University graduate student.

node.title: Kidneys, lives, dollars
node.description: This program features Dr. George E. Shriner, president, National Kidney Foundation; Charles Plant, consultant to National Kidney Foundation; Kidney transplant recipients Rudolfo Debercelli and Arthur Mauk.

node.title: Atlantic community
node.description: Donald Panzera, Georgetown University senior; Sepp Buehler, University of Vienna; and Dr. Paul Ellow, Georgetown University.

node.title: Cancer research breakthrough
node.description: This program features Mark Eastmolsen, Georgetown University; Ernest J. Dupreau, University of Maryland School of Medicine; and Lasalle D. Lafaux, Jr., Howard University. School of Medicine.

node.title: Latin America nationalism
node.description: This program features Dr. Francisco V. Corsiamidore, Organization of American States;  Dr. Joseph L. Tryon, Georgetown University; and Dr. Siegfried Corboni, Georgetown University.

node.title: U.S. foreign investments
node.description: This program features Dr. David C. Mulford, White Weld and Company; Robert O. Sayler, Georgetown University senior; Christian Hoffman, Georgetown University senior; and George Eureka, Investment Bankers Association of America.

node.title: Federal funds to militants
node.description: This program features T. John Own; Robert A. Tonz; Jeff Storey; and Dallas Perkins. All are  members of Georgetown University's College of Arts and Sciences, and debating society.

node.title: Developing the diplomat
node.description: This program features George V. Allen, former United States ambassador to several nations and former director of Foreign Service Institute of State Deptartment; Dr. Jesse A. Mann, Georgetown University; and Dr. Richard Butwell, American University.

node.title: Latin America: Military's role
node.description: This program features James W. Rose, Brookings Institution;  Dr. Luis E. Aguilar, Georgetown University; and Dr. William H. Brill, Georgetown University.

node.title: Peace Corps: New diplomacy
node.description: This program features Reverend George H. Dunn, World Council of Churches; John Curtis, deputy director of public affairs, Peace Corps;  Michael Bowden, director, Georgetown University Community Action Program, former Peace Corps volunteer.

node.title: Student initiative: Free university
node.description: This program features W. Patrick Goen, dean of freshmen, Georgetown University; Reese Fullerton, senior; Scott Riordan, junior; James Heathcox, junior; all Georgetown students

node.title: As others see us
node.description: This program features Reverend Gerard F. Yates, director of international student programs, Georgetown University; and three Georgetown graduate students from Guinea, Brazil, and Greece.

node.title: Future scientists and their teachers
node.description: This program features Dr. Phoebe Knippling, Arlington County, VA, public schools;  Maurice Leikund, fellow, Washington Academy of Scientists; and Grover Sherlin, National Bureau of Standards.

node.title: European reporters on U.S.
node.description: This program features Steven Barber, chief correspondent, London Daily Telegraph; Jean Legranges, national manager, Agence-France Press;  and Wolfgang Nolte, Washington bureau chief, Deutsche Presse Agentur.

node.title: Students on U.S. foreign policy
node.description: This program features William A. Bell, Jr., foreign service officer and member of State Department Open Forum Panel;  and three students from Georgetown University School of Foreign Service:  Dean Krum, Deidre Kelly, and Steven Craven.

node.title: College students and draft
node.description: This program features Betty Vetter, executive director, Scientific Manpower Commission; Michael E. Tiger, attorney and editor, Selective Service Law Reporter.

node.title: The poor and food marketing
node.description: This program presents Dale L. Anderson, foor marketing analyst for U.S. Department of Agriculture; Dr. Wilford L. White, Howard University;  George L. Small, food wholesaler from York, Pa.

node.title: Russian Revolution at sea
node.description: This program features Girard C. Smith, former Assistant Secretary of State and director of policy planning staff of the State Department; Dr. Thomas W. Wolfe, senior staff member, RAND Corp.; L. Edgar Prina, Copley News Service.

node.title: RMP: Master plan for medicine
node.description: This program features medical doctors, Dr. William S. McKuen; Dr. John C. Rose; and Dr. Arthur E. Wentz discussing risk management plans.
